I use Gom player and it skips about 3 min ahead. Vlc stops.

The audio and video qualities are excellent. However, I can confirm what Captprice and Nordentlig referenced. At 2:06:53, while playing via VLC, the movie just stops. I do not use any other programs (I will not insult the .torrent world but trying WMP).

@spaga: .mkv files are only containers. Simply rename the file to .mp4. Then you will be able to play the video file.

FYI - VLC Player plays .mkv files with no issue.

Yes! Average downloadspeed: 5.8MB/s
Video: 10
Audio: 10
Subtitles: Understandable.
Me: One happy camper.

Addition to my previous comment:

I also encountered the problem at 2:06:53

Easy fix when using VLC (If you do not have it, I highly recommend.):

After the video stops playing, Hit play again so it starts, and then hit pause

On the VLC menu bar, click "Playback" and then "Jump to Specific Time"

Type in 02:06:54 and you are good to go without missing a thing.

It may seem like a hassle but the download speeds make it worth it

Thanks again for the top quality movie.
